title: Change app theme color from green to navy blue

requirements.text: Update the global UI theme so the primary brand color is navy blue (not green) across light and dark modes, including primary/ring/sidebar variables and any custom gradient/outline styles that currently use the green hue.

quotes: Ok the theme color should be navy blue not green

acceptanceCriteria: In frontend/src/index.css, CSS variables that currently produce a green primary theme (e.g., --primary, --ring, --sidebar-primary and related foreground/accent variables as appropriate) are updated to a navy-blue palette for both :root and .dark.
Any custom CSS using the previous green color (e.g., .logo-text gradient and .company-name-outline stroke/shadow) is updated to match the navy-blue theme.
Primary buttons/links/focus rings and sidebar highlights render in navy blue throughout the app without introducing unreadable contrast in light or dark mode.

requirements.text: Update PWA/browser theme metadata colors to match the new navy blue theme color.

quotes: Ok the theme color should be navy blue not green

acceptanceCriteria: frontend/index.html meta name="theme-color" and msapplication-TileColor are updated from the current blue value to the chosen navy blue hex value.
frontend/public/manifest.json theme_color is updated from the current value to the same navy blue hex value used in index.html.
After the change, the browser UI/PWA theme color reflects navy blue when the app is loaded/installed.

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (Shadcn) or any paths listed as immutable in SYSTEM_CONTEXT.
nonGoals: No new features, routes, or backend changes.
No changes to logos, icons, or other generated images.
